section.title: COBOL Transformers Generation for a Proxy
section.para: The wizard is started from the package explorer, by right clicking on a previously generated XML Schema and then selecting LegStar->Generate Transformers:
In this case, the root structures we are interested in are Search and SearchResponse, which are the wrapper elements expected and produced by the target Web Service. We select them both.

figure.title: Proxy COBOL Transformers generation screen parameters

section.para: Because Microsoft uses the same names for both Elements and Complex Types, JAXB may complain about name conflicts. To avoid this, you can customize JAXB using the upper options button and specify that all Complex Types should be suffixed with characters "Type":

figure.title: Proxy COBOL Transformers generation screen JAXB options

section.para: After you click finish, two Java packages are created, one for JAXB classes with COBOL annotations and one for the optimized Transformers classes.
